info.title: TrackTik API - Back Office Suite - Payroll

tags.name: employee-premium-assignments
tags.description: Operations to manage Employee Premium Assignments

tags.name: payroll-schedule-occurrences
tags.description: Operations to manage Payroll Schedule Occurrences

tags.name: position-premium-assignments

tags.name: processed-payroll-payruns

get.description: Retrieve a collection of Employee Premium Assignments. You can search and filter the collection using query parameters.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The collection items limit

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The collection items offset

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: List of fields you want returned separated by a coma. You can alias the returned field by adding the alias after a column

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Expand response to get full related object instead of ID. See the expand guide for more info.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The collection items sort field and order (prefix with "-" for descending sort].

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Global search for the object

parameters.name: [att]
parameters.description: Filter any attribute by its value. You can search sub-objects by using the qualified attribute name.

parameters.name: [att]:in
parameters.description: Filter the collection by attribute list.

parameters.name: [att]:contains
parameters.description: Search a specific attribute partially

parameters.name: includeInactive
parameters.description: Return the list of inactive objects in the results. By default only active objects are returned

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Custom filter that could be applied to the collection. Filter by id

parameters.name: idIn
parameters.description: Custom filter that could be applied to the collection. Filter by a list of ids, seperated by a comma.

post.description: Store a new Employee Premium Assignment item.

get.description: Retrieve a Employee Premium Assignment item using its unique identifier.

put.description: Edit a Employee Premium Assignment item completely. To only update some attributes, use the PATCH operation.

patch.summary: Partially update a Employee Premium Assignment
patch.description: Edit a Employee Premium Assignment item partially by passing only the attributes you want to modify.

get.description: Retrieve a Payrun item using its unique identifier.

post.description: Approve and lock a payroll payrun

get.description: Retrieve a collection of Payroll Schedule Occurrences. You can search and filter the collection using query parameters.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
Example of a **required filter** using the **id property**: `id:in=123,456`. 


At least one of the filters (on properties or scope) is `required`. Pseudo filters `:in` and `:between` can be used in
the filters on properties. For the properties of type *date-time* the maximum range for the `:between` pseudo filter is **1 month**.
For the pseudo filter `:in` the maximum allowed number of separated values by comma is **100**.

x-ttc-labels.label: Occurrence ID
x-ttc-labels.description: The unique identifier of the occurrence

id.description: The unique identifier of the occurrence

x-ttc-labels.label: Occurrence date
x-ttc-labels.description: Date at which the payroll period ends

occurrenceDate.description: Date at which the payroll period ends

x-ttc-labels.label: Region
x-ttc-labels.description: Region where the payroll schedule is defined

region.description: Region where the payroll schedule is defined

x-ttc-labels.label: Sub-Region ID
x-ttc-labels.description: Region where payroll can be run

subRegionId.description: Region where payroll can be run

post.description: Publishing the payroll will make the pay stubs available to employees.
Unpublishing the payroll will make the pay stubs unavailable to employees.

fieldsCsv.name: fieldsCsv
fieldsCsv.description: List of fields. firstName:First Name, lastName:Last Name

collectionAttribute.name: [att]
collectionAttribute.description: Filter any attribute by its value. You can search sub-objects by using the qualified attribute name.

collectionInactive.name: includeInactive
collectionInactive.description: Return the list of inactive objects in the results. By default only active objects are returned

collectionAttributeIn.name: [att]:in
collectionAttributeIn.description: Filter the collection by attribute list.

collectionScope.name: scope
collectionScope.description: List of scope that could be applied to the collection. You can apply multiple scopes separated by a coma.

collectionCustomFilter.name: customFilters
collectionCustomFilter.description: Custom filter that could be applied to the collection.

collectionRequiredFilter.name: filters
collectionRequiredFilter.description:
Example of a **required filter** using the **id property**: `id:in=123,456`. 


At least one of the filters (on properties or scope) is `required`. Pseudo filters `:in` and `:between` can be used in
the filters on properties. For the properties of type *date-time* the maximum range for the `:between` pseudo filter is **1 month**.
For the pseudo filter `:in` the maximum allowed number of separated values by comma is **100**.

collectionSort.name: sort
collectionSort.description: The collection items sort field and order (prefix with "-" for descending sort].

collectionFields.name: fields
collectionFields.description: List of fields you want returned separated by a coma. You can alias the returned field by adding the alias after a column

collectionInclude.name: include
collectionInclude.description: Expand response to get full related object instead of ID. See the expand guide for more info.

AccessForbidden.description: Access forbidden, invalid API-KEY was used

OAuth2.description: Recommended method to authenticate to the TrackTik APIs. [Read here for more information.](https://blackstoneconsulting.staffr.us/rest/v1/2020-01-01/system/oauth2)

scopes.<domain>:read: Read access to all the resources of the specified domain
scopes.<domain>:write: Write access to all the resources of the specified domain
scopes.<domain>:<module>:read: Read access to all the resources of the specified module
scopes.<domain>:<module>:write: Write access to all the resources of the specified module
scopes.<domain>:<module>:<resource>:read: Write access to the specified resource
scopes.<domain>:<module>:<resource>:write: Read access to the specified resource
scopes.<domain>:<module>:<resource>:action:<act: Access to the execute the specified action on the specified resource

scopes.<domain>:<module>:<resource>:write: Read access to the specified resource
scopes.<domain>:<module>:<resource>:action:<act: Access to the execute the specified action on the specified resource
